summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Federal Bureau of Prisons legal counsel, transmitting a laptop for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell to review discovery materials in her criminal case. The letter details the security modifications made to the laptop to disable recording and communication capabilities.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center who is to receive a specially modified laptop for reviewing discovery materials in her criminal case, United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter authorizing the provision of a laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell for discovery review.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the prosecution of Maxwell and authorizing the provision of discovery materials to her as the defendant.

events.title: Laptop Provision for Discovery Review
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office provides a secured laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center to review discovery materials in her criminal case.

locations: Southern District of New York, The Silvio Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office provided a laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell for discovery review in her criminal case (20 Cr. 330).
The laptop was modified to disable all recording capabilities (microphone, camera) and communication capabilities (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Ethernet).
The laptop was also modified to remove any game programs.
The letter emphasizes the laptop is for the sole purpose of reviewing discovery materials.
The correspondence highlights the security protocols in place for a high-profile defendant's access to case materials.
